Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXFromFileSaveDialog

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(PARAMETER)
public @interface AFXFromFileSaveDialog
    Method argument annotation which request the value of the annotated argument of type File, String, Path or URI from a "file save" dialog.

    In case the dialog is cancelled and no file is chosen, the method invocation is also cancelled, unless you set the attribute continueOnCancel() to true. If this is the case, the method argument will be null.

    Author:
    koster

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean continueOnCancel
      Flag that determines what shall happen, in case the user cancels the "file save" dialog.
      java.lang.String[] extensionFilter
      An optional extension filter for setting in the "file save" dialog.
      java.lang.String title
      The title to be displayed in the "file save" dialog.
      java.lang.String titleKey
      A resource bundle property key for the title text to be displayed in the "file save" dialog.

    • Element Detail

      • title

        java.lang.String title
        The title to be displayed in the "file save" dialog.
        Returns:
        the title of the file save dialog. Default is "Save File"
        Default:
        "Save File"

      • titleKey

        java.lang.String titleKey
        A resource bundle property key for the title text to be displayed in the "file save" dialog. A value in this attribute has a higher priority than the value specified in title().
        Returns:
        the resource bundle property key for a "file save" dialog title
        Default:
        ""

      • extensionFilter

        java.lang.String[] extensionFilter
        An optional extension filter for setting in the "file save" dialog. It follows the same semantics than FileChooser.ExtensionFilter, i.e. the first element in the array is a description like "Music Files" and all following array elements are the allowed file extensions like "*.mp3", "*.wav", "*.ogg", etc.

        Example: 

         extensionFilter = {"Music Files", "*.mp3", "*.wav", "*.ogg"}
        Returns:
        the array with a description as first element and the allowed extensions as following array elemments
        Default:
        {}

      • continueOnCancel

        boolean continueOnCancel
        Flag that determines what shall happen, in case the user cancels the "file save" dialog. By default, the method invocation is also cancelled, when the "file save" dialog is cancelled. If this flag is set to true, the method is invoked even if the "file save" dialog is cancelled. In that case, the method argument will be null.
        Returns:
        true, if the method shall be invoked, even if the "file save" dialog is cancelled, false, if the method invocation shall be also cancelled. Default is false.
        Default:
        false
